title: Understanding the Values Area
text: The values area in a PivotTable is where you place fields that you want to summarize or aggregate. These fields typically contain numbers that you want to calculate totals, averages, or other summary statistics for.

title: Numeric Data in Values Area
text: Fields added to the values area should contain numeric data because this area is used for calculations like sums, averages, and counts.

hintAnswer: fields added to the values area must contain numeric data from the source data
title: Identifying the Correct Choice
text: Which of the following statements correctly describes the fields added to the values area in a PivotTable?
choices: report filter and filter button in the PivotTable, representing a subset that meets a selection criterion
fields directly added to the columns fields should contain summary numeric area
fields added to the rows area become subsets of the first field
fields added to the values area must contain numeric data from the source data
